intro: Doratoxylon mauritanum, commonly known as the Mauritanian thornbush, is a shrub native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by capsule fruits containing several seeds. It is adapted to survive in hot, dry environments with poor soil conditions. Doratoxylon mauritanum plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for local wildlife.
